article_title: ETFs Make Buying International Small-Caps Easier
article_text:
Are smaller overseas stocks a place to venture?

Small-capitalization stocks, especially those abroad, have been tough nuts to crack for most individual investors, mainly because of the sheer numbers of such issues and the fact that few analysts cover them.

The lack of information, coupled with liquidity concerns about companies in developing countries, has meant most American investors historically have stayed away from this...

twitter.description: Some U.S. investors are dipping a toe in this corner of the market, with funds focused on Europe one of their main targets.
twitter.title: ETFs Make Foreign Small-Caps Easier to Buy

image.alt: Buying international small-caps has gotten easier (but still riskier), thanks to ETFs
